title: Ultimate Guide to REI Outlet Climbing Shoes: Best Deals and Expert Tips for 2025
description: Complete guide to finding the best climbing shoes deals at REI outlet, featuring expert recommendations, brand comparisons, and insider tips for saving money on quality climbing footwear.

    }

      box-shadow: 0 4px 8px rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.1);

    }

body:
Ultimate Guide to REI Outlet Climbing Shoes: Best Deals and Expert Tips for 2025

After fifteen years of climbing everything from Yosemite's granite walls to the sandstone towers of Utah, I've learned that finding quality climbing shoes at affordable prices can make or break your climbing budget. REI outlet has become my go-to destination for scoring incredible deals on premium climbing footwear, and I'm here to share everything I've discovered about navigating their outlet section like a pro. Whether you're a weekend warrior or a seasoned crusher, this comprehensive guide will help you find the perfect pair of climbing shoes without breaking the bank. Explore National Parks Store is your ultimate resource for outdoor gear insights and adventures.

Table of Contents

  • Why I Trust REI Outlet for Climbing Shoes
  • Best REI Outlet Climbing Shoe Deals Right Now
  • My Experience Finding the Perfect Climbing Shoes at REI Outlet
  • Top Brand Comparison: La Sportiva vs Evolv vs Black Diamond
  • How to Score the Best Deals at REI Outlet
  • Common Mistakes When Buying Outlet Climbing Shoes
  • Frequently Asked Questions
  • Conclusion

Why I Trust REI Outlet for Climbing Shoes

When I first discovered REI's outlet section five years ago during a climbing trip to Joshua Tree, I was skeptical about buying discounted climbing shoes. Would they be damaged? Outdated models? After purchasing my first pair of rei outlet climbing shoes – a pair of La Sportiva Tarantulaces at 40% off – I realized I had been missing out on one of climbing's best-kept secrets.

REI's outlet operates differently from typical clearance sections. They feature genuine overstock, end-of-season items, and previous year models – not damaged goods. During my visit to their flagship Seattle store, a seasoned climbing specialist explained that most rei outlet climbing shoes are simply discontinued colorways or models making room for newer releases. This means you're getting the same quality and performance at significantly reduced prices.

What sets REI outlet apart is their 100% satisfaction guarantee, which applies even to outlet purchases. I've personally returned outlet climbing shoes that didn't fit properly, and the staff was incredibly helpful in finding alternatives. This safety net removes the biggest risk of buying discounted climbing gear online. Additionally, REI members earn dividends on outlet purchases, making the deals even sweeter.

The selection at REI outlet consistently includes premium brands like La Sportiva, Evolv, Black Diamond, and Scarpa – brands that rarely go on sale elsewhere. I've found shoes from their hiking shoes outlet section that work perfectly for approach shoes, and their climbing-specific inventory rotates frequently enough to keep checking back worthwhile.

Pro Tip: Sign up for REI outlet email notifications. They send alerts when new climbing shoes hit the outlet section, giving you first dibs on the best deals before they sell out in popular sizes.

Best REI Outlet Climbing Shoe Deals Right Now

Based on my latest scouting of the REI outlet section, here are the standout rei outlet climbing shoes deals that offer exceptional value. I've tested several of these models personally and can vouch for their performance across different climbing disciplines.

The La Sportiva Genius currently sits at $136.73, down from $219 – a 37% savings that's hard to ignore. I've worn the Genius for technical face climbing in Yosemite, and the precision on tiny edges is remarkable. The aggressive downturn and soft rubber make it ideal for steep sport routes and boulder problems. For climbers progressing into 5.11+ territory, this shoe delivers professional-grade performance at an accessible price point.

Current Top Deals:

  • Evolv Geshido: $139.93 (save 29%) - Excellent all-around performance shoe
  • La Sportiva Genius: $136.73 (save 37%) - Aggressive downturn for steep climbing
  • Evolv V6: $142.93 (save 20%) - Modern classic with superior edging
  • Black Diamond Focus: $96.73 (save 46%) - Great beginner to intermediate option
  • Evolv Shaman Lace: $158.93 (save 20%) - Versatile lace-up design

For beginners, the Black Diamond Momentum series remains unbeatable value at outlet prices. I recommend these shoes to everyone starting their climbing journey because they offer comfort during long gym sessions while still providing the precision needed for outdoor climbing. The flat last and moderate stiffness make them forgiving as you develop foot technique.

Amazon also carries several of these models, though often at higher prices. The La Sportiva Tarantulace on Amazon currently retails for $98.95, while REI outlet occasionally has them for under $80. Similarly, Black Diamond Momentum shoes on Amazon are priced at $99.95, making the REI outlet deals particularly attractive.

What I love about shopping REI outlet is finding last season's models that are virtually identical to current versions. The Evolv Geshido, for instance, has remained largely unchanged for three years, yet the outlet version costs $60 less than current retail. These savings allow you to invest in other essential climbing gear from their outdoor gear outlet selection.

Sizing Alert: Outlet climbing shoes often sell out quickly in popular sizes (9-11 for men, 7-9 for women). If you find your size in a model you want, don't hesitate – these deals disappear fast.

My Experience Finding the Perfect Climbing Shoes at REI Outlet

My journey with rei outlet climbing shoes began three years ago when I was preparing for a trip to Red River Gorge. I needed aggressive shoes for the area's steep, technical routes but didn't want to spend $200+ on a single pair. A climbing partner mentioned REI's outlet section, and I decided to investigate.

Walking into the REI flagship store in Denver, I was amazed by the outlet selection. The climbing shoe wall featured everything from beginner-friendly models to high-end performance shoes, all marked down significantly. A knowledgeable staff member, Sarah, who had been climbing for over a decade, helped me understand the subtle differences between outlet models and current versions.

She explained that most rei outlet climbing shoes are either previous colorways, overstock from the manufacturer, or models being phased out for newer designs. The performance and construction remain identical – you're simply getting last season's aesthetics at this season's discounted prices. This revelation changed my entire approach to buying climbing gear.

What I Learned During My First Outlet Purchase:

  • Try multiple brands – sizing varies significantly between manufacturers
  • Outlet shoes have the same warranty as full-price items
  • Staff knowledge about discontinued models is excellent
  • Return policy applies fully to outlet purchases
  • Some outlet models outperform current versions

I ended up purchasing Evolv Shamans for $119, down from $189. These shoes became my go-to for everything from gym sessions to multi-pitch trad routes. The lace-up design provided the perfect balance of performance and comfort, and I've since recommended them to dozens of climbing partners. The experience taught me that outlet shopping isn't about compromising on quality – it's about being smart with timing and selection.

Since then, I've purchased six more pairs of climbing shoes from REI outlet, including approach shoes from their hiking boot outlet section that work perfectly for alpine approaches. Each purchase has reinforced my confidence in the outlet's quality and value proposition. The money saved has allowed me to expand my gear collection, including items from their mountain equipment outlet.

One particularly memorable experience was finding La Sportiva Solutions in my size for $98, down from $169. These are widely considered among the best high-performance climbing shoes available, and getting them at nearly 40% off felt like winning the lottery. I wore them for some of my hardest sends, including my first 5.12a in Red Rocks, Nevada.

Success Story: The La Sportiva Solutions I bought from REI outlet lasted two full seasons of intensive climbing, from gym training to outdoor sport routes, proving that outlet shoes offer the same durability as full-price options.

Top Brand Comparison: La Sportiva vs Evolv vs Black Diamond

Having extensively tested rei outlet climbing shoes from multiple brands over the years, I've developed strong opinions about which manufacturers offer the best value in the outlet context. Each brand brings distinct characteristics that appeal to different climbing styles and preferences.

La Sportiva: The Italian Precision Masters

La Sportiva consistently dominates the outlet section with models like the Tarantulace, Finale, and Genius. Their Italian craftsmanship shows in every detail, from the precise lasted construction to the strategic rubber placement. I've found La Sportiva outlet shoes retain their shape longer than other brands, making them excellent investments even at full price.

The Tarantulace, frequently available through Amazon, represents La Sportiva's commitment to beginner-friendly design without sacrificing performance. In outlet form, these shoes offer incredible value for climbers progressing through the 5.7 to 5.10 grades. The wide toe box accommodates most foot shapes comfortably, while the Vibram XS Edge rubber provides reliable friction on various rock types.

La Sportiva Outlet Pros & Cons:

Pros:
  • Exceptional build quality
  • Wide variety of models
  • Proven durability
  • Consistent sizing
Cons:
  • Higher outlet prices
  • Limited aggressive models
  • Break-in period required
  • European sizing confusion

Evolv: The American Innovation Leaders

Evolv's presence in REI outlet has grown significantly, with models like the Geshido, Shaman, and V6 appearing regularly. Their American-designed shoes focus on innovative features like adjustable heel loops and unique rubber compounds. I've been particularly impressed with how Evolv outlet shoes punch above their price point in performance.

The Evolv Geshido deserves special mention for its versatility. Available in outlet for around $139, this shoe transitions seamlessly from gym climbing to outdoor routes. The synthetic upper stretches minimally, maintaining fit consistency throughout long climbing sessions. This makes them ideal for climbers who frequent both indoor and outdoor venues, especially when traveling to areas covered in our camping outlet near me guides.

Black Diamond: The Value Performance Champions

Black Diamond's outlet presence includes their popular Momentum series and more technical options like the Focus and Method. Having owned multiple pairs of Black Diamond Momentum shoes, I can attest to their beginner-friendly nature and surprising durability. The brand excels at creating shoes that perform well above their price point.

The Momentum's flat profile and comfortable fit make it perfect for new climbers spending hours in the gym. When found in REI outlet for under $80, they represent one of climbing's best value propositions. I've recommended these shoes to countless beginners, and the feedback has been universally positive. They bridge the gap between rental shoes and performance climbing footwear perfectly.

Brand Recommendation: For outlet shopping, prioritize La Sportiva for long-term durability, Evolv for cutting-edge features, and Black Diamond for unbeatable value in beginner to intermediate shoes.

When comparing outlet availability, Black Diamond models appear most frequently, followed by Evolv and then La Sportiva. This pattern reflects each brand's production volume and distribution strategy. However, when premium La Sportiva models hit the outlet, they offer the best long-term value despite higher initial costs.

How to Score the Best Deals at REI Outlet

After years of successfully hunting rei outlet climbing shoes, I've developed a systematic approach that consistently yields the best deals. The key lies in understanding REI's inventory cycles, seasonal patterns, and strategic timing for maximum savings.

The most important insight is that REI restocks their outlet section on Tuesdays and Fridays. I've noticed that climbing shoes typically appear on Tuesday restocks, coinciding with their weekly inventory updates. Setting a calendar reminder for Tuesday morning checks has helped me snag limited-size deals before they disappear. This timing strategy has saved me hundreds of dollars across multiple purchases.

My Proven Deal-Hunting Strategy:

  1. Create a watchlist: Note models and sizes you're interested in
  2. Check Tuesday mornings: New outlet inventory typically uploads between 6-9 AM PST
  3. Use REI app alerts: Enable notifications for specific brands or categories
  4. Know your sizing: Try shoes in-store first, then hunt online for deals
  5. Act quickly: Popular sizes in good models sell within hours

Seasonal timing plays a crucial role in outlet availability. Late fall brings the year's best selection as brands clear inventory for new spring releases. I've found September through November offers the deepest discounts and widest selection of rei outlet climbing shoes. Conversely, spring months see limited outlet inventory as climbing season approaches and demand peaks.

REI members enjoy additional benefits when shopping outlet items. The annual dividend applies to outlet purchases, effectively adding another 10% back for future purchases. I've used dividend earnings to fund entire climbing trips, turning gear savings into adventure funding. The member-exclusive sales events also feature additional outlet markdowns, sometimes reaching 50-60% off original retail.

Location matters when hunting outlet deals. While online selection is vast, physical REI stores sometimes carry outlet items not available online. During visits to climbing destinations, I always check local REI stores for regional outlet inventory. This strategy has uncovered unique finds, including discontinued colorways and limited-edition models. Some locations near climbing areas like their outdoor clothing outlet sections stock items that quickly move elsewhere.

Insider Tip: Follow REI's social media accounts and sign up for their email newsletter. They occasionally announce flash outlet sales with additional markdowns lasting 24-48 hours.

Price tracking becomes essential for serious outlet hunters. I use browser bookmarks to monitor specific models across different sizes. When prices drop further or new sizes become available, I can act immediately. This patience-and-vigilance approach has helped me secure premium shoes like the Climb X Rave at unprecedented discounts.

Don't overlook approach shoes in the outlet section. Models from their Salomon hiking shoes outlet work perfectly for scrambling and easy climbing approaches. These hybrid shoes often appear in outlet at exceptional prices, providing versatility for climbers who also enjoy hiking and mountaineering pursuits covered in our mountain gear outlet resources.

Common Mistakes When Buying Outlet Climbing Shoes

Through my years of experience with rei outlet climbing shoes and helping fellow climbers navigate deals, I've observed recurring mistakes that cost money and performance. Understanding these pitfalls can save you from expensive regrets and ensure your outlet purchases enhance rather than hinder your climbing progression.

The biggest mistake I see is buying shoes solely based on discount percentage rather than fit and intended use. A 50% discount means nothing if the shoes don't match your foot shape or climbing style. I once purchased La Sportiva Solutions at an incredible outlet price, only to discover they were too aggressive for my current climbing level. The shoes sat unused for months until I developed the technique to utilize their performance potential effectively.

Critical Error: Never buy climbing shoes online without first trying the same model in a store. Sizing varies dramatically between brands and even between different models from the same manufacturer.

Another common error is stockpiling multiple pairs without considering actual usage patterns. Climbing shoes have a limited shelf life – rubber compounds deteriorate over time regardless of use. I learned this lesson when three pairs of outlet shoes I'd stored as "backups" developed sole separation after two years in my gear closet. Now I limit purchases to immediate needs plus one backup pair maximum.

Ignoring return policies leads to costly mistakes. While REI's satisfaction guarantee covers outlet purchases, some climbers assume outlet items are "final sale." I've seen climbers suffer through poorly fitting shoes rather than exchange them. REI's staff has always been helpful with outlet returns, treating them identically to full-price purchases. This policy should provide confidence to try outlet shoes knowing exchanges are possible.

Top 5 Outlet Shopping Mistakes to Avoid:

  1. Buying wrong size: Outlet shoes can't be tried on first – know your size precisely
  2. Ignoring intended use: Aggressive shoes aren't suitable for beginners regardless of price
  3. Hoarding deals: Buy what you'll use within 6-12 months
  4. Skipping research: Read reviews and understand model characteristics before buying
  5. Forgetting accessories: Factor in costs for items from hiking outlet sections

Timing mistakes cost opportunities and money. Waiting too long on a good deal means losing your size to other shoppers, while impulse buying without research leads to regrettable purchases. I've developed a 24-hour rule for outlet shoes over $100 – I research reviews, compare alternatives, and sleep on the decision. This cooling-off period has saved me from several poor choices while rarely causing me to miss truly great deals.

Overlooking shipping costs and return logistics affects total value. While REI offers free shipping on orders over $50, returning outlet items might incur shipping costs if you need to exchange sizes. Factor these potential expenses when comparing outlet deals to full-price alternatives available locally. Sometimes the convenience of trying shoes at a nearby hiking outlet store justifies slightly higher prices.

Finally, don't assume outlet inventory will reappear. Unlike regular retail items that restock predictably, outlet deals are typically one-time opportunities. If you find your size in a model you've researched and want, don't expect it to be available later. I've learned to treat good outlet finds as limited-time offers requiring immediate decisions based on prior research and preparation.

Success Strategy: Create a wish list with specific models and sizes you want, research reviews thoroughly, then act decisively when outlet opportunities arise. This preparation eliminates decision paralysis while ensuring smart purchases.

Frequently Asked Questions

Are REI outlet climbing shoes the same quality as full-price shoes?

Absolutely. REI outlet climbing shoes are identical in construction and performance to their full-price counterparts. The outlet section features overstock inventory, discontinued colorways, and previous season models – not damaged or defective items. I've extensively tested outlet shoes against current models and found no quality differences. The same manufacturing standards, materials, and construction techniques apply regardless of pricing. REI's 100% satisfaction guarantee covers outlet purchases equally, demonstrating their confidence in outlet quality. The primary difference lies in aesthetics (color variations) or timing (last season's releases), not performance or durability.

How often does REI restock their outlet climbing shoes?

REI typically updates their outlet inventory twice weekly, with the most significant restocks occurring on Tuesdays and Fridays. Climbing shoes appear more frequently during fall months (September through November) when manufacturers clear inventory for new releases. However, outlet inventory is unpredictable by nature – it depends on manufacturer overstock, returns, and seasonal factors beyond REI's control. I recommend checking the outlet section at least weekly, with Tuesday morning being the optimal time. Setting up email alerts for specific brands or categories can notify you immediately when desired items become available, giving you the best chance at securing popular sizes.

Can I return or exchange climbing shoes bought from REI outlet?

Yes, REI's famous satisfaction guarantee applies fully to outlet purchases. You can return or exchange outlet climbing shoes using the same generous policy as full-price items – typically within one year of purchase with proof of purchase. I've personally returned outlet shoes that didn't fit properly and received full refunds or exchanges. The return process for outlet items is identical to regular merchandise: bring items to any REI store or ship them back using REI's prepaid return labels. This policy provides confidence when buying outlet shoes online, knowing you can exchange sizes if needed. The guarantee removes the biggest risk of outlet shopping, making REI outlet shoes nearly risk-free investments.

What's the best time of year to find climbing shoes in REI outlet?

Fall months, specifically September through November, offer the year's best selection and deepest discounts on climbing shoes in REI outlet. This timing coincides with manufacturers releasing new spring collections and clearing previous year inventory. Holiday seasons also bring additional markdowns as REI makes room for new gear. Spring months see limited outlet climbing shoe availability as demand peaks with climbing season approaching. I've found that post-holiday January brings scattered great deals as returned items enter outlet inventory. Summer offers moderate selection with fewer deep discounts. For serious outlet hunters, fall represents the sweet spot when selection, pricing, and availability align optimally for finding premium climbing shoes at exceptional values.

Do REI members get additional discounts on outlet climbing shoes?

REI members receive the same 10% annual dividend on outlet purchases as regular-priced items, effectively providing an additional discount when dividends are distributed each spring. Members also get early access to special sale events that sometimes feature additional outlet markdowns of 10-20%. During member-exclusive sales, I've seen climbing shoes reach 50-60% off original retail prices. The $30 lifetime membership fee pays for itself quickly when regularly shopping outlet items. Members also receive exclusive email notifications about new outlet arrivals and flash sales. While the initial discount isn't higher for members, the dividend and exclusive access benefits make membership valuable for frequent outlet shoppers. These combined benefits have saved me hundreds of dollars over multiple years of outlet purchases.

Conclusion

Navigating the world of rei outlet climbing shoes has transformed how I approach gear purchasing and climbing progression. What began as skepticism about discounted climbing footwear evolved into a systematic strategy that has saved me thousands of dollars while providing access to premium climbing shoes I otherwise couldn't justify purchasing.

The key insights from my years of outlet hunting boil down to preparation, timing, and patience. Understanding that REI outlet features genuine overstock rather than inferior products removes the biggest barrier to confident purchasing. Knowing that Tuesday mornings bring fresh inventory, fall months offer the best selection, and REI's satisfaction guarantee covers all outlet purchases provides the framework for successful outlet shopping.

Beyond the financial benefits, shopping REI outlet has introduced me to models and brands I might have overlooked at full price. Some of my favorite climbing shoes – including the Evolv Shamans that accompanied me on multi-pitch routes throughout the Southwest – were outlet discoveries that outperformed my expectations. This serendipitous aspect of outlet shopping has expanded my gear knowledge and climbing capabilities.

Your Next Steps:

  • Visit REI to try different brands and determine your sizing
  • Create a wishlist of specific models you want
  • Set up email alerts for REI outlet notifications
  • Check outlet inventory every Tuesday morning
  • Consider REI membership for additional benefits

The climbing shoe landscape continues evolving with new technologies and materials, but the fundamental principles of outlet shopping remain constant. Quality gear doesn't require full retail prices when you understand timing, selection, and brand characteristics. REI outlet provides access to the same innovations that drive climbing performance, just at prices that make progression more accessible.

For climbers exploring other gear categories, the same principles apply across REI's outlet sections. Whether you're seeking items from their outdoor clothing outlet near me or browsing their outlet walking boots, the strategies and insights shared here translate directly to other outdoor gear categories.

Remember that climbing shoes are just one component of a complete climbing kit. The money saved through smart outlet shopping can fund other essential gear, from women's climbing shoes for your partner to safety equipment that keeps adventures safe and enjoyable. Building a comprehensive gear collection doesn't require unlimited budgets – it requires smart shopping strategies and patience to find quality deals.

The journey from outlet skeptic to outlet evangelist has enriched my climbing experience beyond simple cost savings. It's connected me with knowledgeable REI staff, introduced me to new brands and technologies, and provided the confidence to try gear I might otherwise avoid. Most importantly, it's enabled climbing adventures that might have been financially prohibitive with full-price gear purchases.

Shop REI Outlet Climbing Shoes Now

Your climbing progression doesn't need to wait for gear sales or budget increases. REI outlet provides immediate access to quality climbing shoes that can elevate your performance today. Whether you're projecting your first 5.10 or working toward 5.12, the right shoes at the right price are waiting in the outlet section. Start your outlet hunting journey today, and discover how smart shopping can accelerate your climbing goals while keeping your wallet happy.

What Climbers Are Saying

"Bought La Sportiva Tarantulaces from REI outlet for $75, down from $129. Two years later, they're still going strong after hundreds of gym sessions and outdoor climbs. Best gear purchase I've ever made!"

- Sarah M., Reddit r/climbing

"REI outlet Evolv Shamans were game-changers for my climbing. Got them for 30% off and they fit perfectly. The lace-up design lets me adjust tension throughout long climbing days. Highly recommend checking the outlet section regularly."

- Mike T., Amazon Verified Purchase

"Initially skeptical about buying climbing shoes from outlet, but REI's return policy gave me confidence. Ended up with Black Diamond Momentum shoes that have been perfect for learning. The comfort during long sessions is unmatched, and the price was unbeatable."

- Jessica L., Quora Climbing Community
